text: Neil Gillman (September 11, 1933 â€“ November 24, 2017) was a Canadian-American rabbi and philosopher affiliated with Conservative Judaism. He was born in Quebec City, Canada. He was a member of the Conservative movement's rabbinical body, the Rabbinical Assembly, and was a professor of Jewish philosophy at the Jewish Theological Seminary of America, in Manhattan. Gillman died on November 24, 2017 in Manhattan, New York of thrombosis at the age of 84.Rabbi Neil Gillman, a premier theologian of Conservative Judaism, is dead at 84 ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American philosophers Category:American rabbis Category:Canadian Jews Category:Deaths from thrombosis Category:Jewish American academics Category:People from Quebec City Category:Canadian philosophers Category:Educators from New York City
title: Neil Gillman
